  2. Reduced submission errors, faster processing, fewer rejections.

x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: As Nigeria and many governments digitise services (e.g., via services.gov.ng), citizens face barriers in using online forms due to poor accessibility, complexity, and repeated data entry. Some citizens have low literacy, disabilities (visual impairment, motor challenges), or limited digital skills. Filling forms become daunting, error-prone, and exclusionary. Therefore: Many are excluded from e-government services, errors in submissions cause delays, rejections, or frustration and government workflows suffer inefficiencies and high rejection rates.

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

No ServiceNow Products listed for this solution

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  1. Access to government form APIs or endpoints (or ability to embed via HTTP).

  2. OCR / document scanning / optical character recognition library.

  3. Speech synthesis / voice guidance engine + local language support.

  4. Secure profile data storage / encryption.

  5. Mobile / web interface design.

  6. Offline data queuing / sync logic.

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  1. Government API access / cooperation: Some forms may not be exposed or may reject proxy submissions.

  2. Language coverage: Voice guidance must support multiple Nigerian / African languages.

  3. OCR accuracy: Poor camera quality or lighting can reduce extraction accuracy.

  4. Data privacy & consent: Must manage users’ trust and ensure legal compliance (e.g. Nigeria Data Protection Regulation).

  5. User training / adoption: Some citizens may resist using a new interface.

  6. Maintenance of form templates: Government forms change; templates must be updated actively.
